app

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • app.Main
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskControllerTest

    public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    This is the entry point of the application. By default, if there are no command arguments passed into this, the application will launch normally. If there are command arguments, the application will launch as an integration test with the command arguments simulated as user inputs. Main also acts as the bridge between the View and Controller components by providing getters.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Entry method. NOTE: The order of view and controller component initialization is important, and should not be swapped.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        stage - The Stage object which the JavaFX application lives in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Only for integration tests. If the input is invalid, throw an InvalidInputException.

        public java.net.URL getResourceURL(java.lang.String relativePath)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An URL object containing the path to the resource.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Entry point of the application. Arguments can be passed in through this method, and they are used for integration testing.
        Parameters:
        args - (For integration testing) Simulated user command inputs in a String array.
